patterns.title: Patterns
patterns.description: Understanding different skillset patterns in rhythm games

stream.title: Stream
stream.description: Continuous single notes requiring finger independence and speed

content.definition: Stream patterns consist of continuous single notes played in rapid succession, typically requiring each finger to hit individual notes without chord formations.
content.gif_description: Example of stream pattern showing continuous single notes
characteristics: Single notes only (no chords or not much)

jumpstream.title: Jumpstream
jumpstream.description: Mix of single notes and 2-note chords in flowing patterns

content.definition: Jumpstream combines single notes with 2-note jumps (chords), creating flowing patterns that test both chord accuracy and single note speed.
content.gif_description: Example of jumpstream showing mix of single notes and 2-note chords
characteristics: Mix of single notes and 2-note chords

handstream.title: Handstream
handstream.description: Dense chord patterns requiring both hands simultaneously

content.definition: Handstream features dense patterns of 3+ note chords with single between them.
content.gif_description: Example of handstream showing dense 3+ note chord patterns
characteristics: Dense patterns with singles between them

chordjack.title: Chordjack
chordjack.description: Repetitive chord patterns testing consistency and stamina

content.definition: Chordjack patterns feature repetitive chord sequences, often with the same chord repeated multiple times, testing consistency and stamina.
content.gif_description: Example of chordjack showing repetitive chord patterns

jackspeed.title: Jackspeed
jackspeed.description: Single key repetition at high speeds

content.definition: Jackspeed involves rapid repetition of single keys, testing finger stamina and speed on individual fingers.
content.gif_description: Example of jackspeed showing single key repetition at high speeds

stamina.title: Stamina
stamina.description: Long, endurance-focused patterns testing physical limits

content.definition: Stamina patterns are characterized by their length and sustained difficulty, testing physical endurance over extended periods.
content.gif_description: Example of stamina showing extended pattern duration

example_beatmaps.title: Livin La Vida Loca by pow wow zee

technical.title: Technical
technical.description: Complex patterns requiring precision and pattern recognition

content.definition: Technical patterns feature complex note arrangements that prioritize precision, pattern recognition, and skillful execution over raw speed.
content.gif_description: Example of technical showing complex note arrangements

ratings.title: MSD Rating System
ratings.description: Understanding the MSD (Mina Standard Difficulty) rating system

overall.title: Overall Rating
overall.description: The main difficulty rating that combines all skillsets

content.definition: The Overall rating represents the general difficulty of a beatmap, calculated by combining ratings from all individual skillsets.
content.calculation: The overall rating is computed using a weighted average of individual skillset ratings, with emphasis on the player's strongest and weakest areas.
interpretation: Higher values indicate more difficult maps

skillsets.title: Skillset Ratings
skillsets.description: Individual ratings for each pattern type

content.definition: Each beatmap receives individual ratings for different skillsets (Stream, Jumpstream, etc.), showing which patterns are most prominent.
reading_charts: Radar charts show all skillsets at once
usage_tips: Focus on your weakest skillsets for improvement
Find maps strong in patterns you enjoy

rates.title: Rate Modifiers
rates.description: How speed modifications affect difficulty ratings

content.definition: Rate modifiers change the playback speed of beatmaps, affecting difficulty. Common rates include 0.9x (slower) to 1.1x+ (faster).

common_rates.0.9x: 10% slower - Easier timing, good for learning

difficulty_scaling: Higher rates increase all skillset ratings
Some patterns scale more than others
practice_usage: Use lower rates to learn difficult patterns
Practice at normal rate for skill building
Use higher rates for speed training
Find your comfort zone for improvement
content.rating_calculation: Rate modifiers multiply base difficulty by rate-specific scaling factors, with different curves for each skillset.
